New Records: Lane Thomas hit a three-run home run in the first inning, contributing to the Guardians' five-run first inning and ultimately a 7-0 shutout win over the Tigers.
Key Match Events: The Guardians scored five runs in the first inning, with Lane Thomas' three-run home run being the highlight.
Tanner Bibee shut down the Tigers in the top of the first inning.
Stephen Vogt made his postseason managerial debut and went to his bullpen early to preserve a dominant shutout win.
Pre-Game Insights: Tigers manager A.J. Hinch made the decision to go with an opener in Tyler Holton, which backfired as he surrendered two hits, one walk, four total runs and three earned runs without getting an out.
Post-Match Reflections: Stephen Vogt received praise from fans on social media for his managerial debut and the team's performance.
Vogt's lineup positioning and bullpen usage were highlighted as key factors in the Guardians' win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Guardians now have to be considered favorites to go to the ALCS, but they still have a ton of work ahead of them.
Things will be much tougher for the Cleveland lineup in Game 2 when the Tigers deploy ace Tarik Skubal.
